title: Technical Program Manager, Audio | Home
summary: there’s no telling what you could accomplish. We provide equal opportunities. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it! We are seeking a people manager and product leadership role with in-region Audio/Home Technical Operations team. This role has cradle to grave product responsibility, handling multi-functional technical team in a matrix organization, interacting with multi-functional leaders within the line of business and developing support strategy for the product roadmap.
description: -  OEM partners selection, supply chain development and post ramp continuous improvements activities; -  Lead team by example to develop outstanding factory processes improving on all standard methodologies and known methods, drive SMART factory initiatives through implementation and strategically deploy machine findings solutions; -  Collaborate with Engineering and influencing new product development strategy; -  Work with USA engineering, suppliers, contract manufacturers and Apple internal multi-functional teams to ensure detailed execution of all new product introduction activities; -  Coordinate factory activities, liaison the Asia, US and suppliers through clear communication; -  Work with Product Design Engineering to assess product features for manufacturability and recommend capable assembly processes; -  Dedication to drive yield improvement and warranty cost reduction; -  Develop, coach and establish team competencies; -  Develop site technical, operational and management systems while providing leadership to ensure repeatable successful ramps.
key_qualifications: - Understand mechanical drawing, GD&T, and ERS (engineering requirement specification); - Experienced in high volume commercial electronics industry, and in relevant job function, e.g. quality engineer, process engineer, PD etc. - Familiar with common measurement metrology and FA method; - Solid understanding of precision component fabrication and assembly process ; - Good in statistical analysis, experienced use of JMP or mini tab is a plus; - Good at failure analysis; - Excellent problem solver, using structured problem solving methodology to assign root cause, plus develop and implement corrective and preventative actions; - Hands-on in the factory processes, with frequent time spent on the factory floor; - Build formal networks involving coordination among groups; - Excellent communicator who can translate high-level goals into tangible action plans; - Proficient in Chinese and English, spoken and written; - Flexible for travel, mostly domestic with possibility of international travel.
education_experience: BS degree in Mechanical / Electrical-Mechanical / Industrial Engineering and/or relevant work experience
